messages.content: What is the purpose of the ComfyUI-safety-checker node?
The ComfyUI-safety-checker node is designed to identify and handle Not Safe For Work (NSFW) content in images generated or processed using ComfyUI.
What type of model does the safety checker node utilize?
The safety checker node utilizes a pretrained CLIP-based model from CompVis, specifically designed for safety checks in images.
How does the safety checker node handle detected NSFW images?
When the safety checker node detects NSFW content in an image, it replaces the image with a solid black placeholder.
Can the sensitivity level of the NSFW detection be adjusted?
Yes, the sensitivity level of the NSFW detection in the ComfyUI-safety-checker node can be adjusted. The standard value is set at 0.5.
What does a sensitivity level of 0.5 indicate in the safety checker node?
A sensitivity level of 0.5 in the ComfyUI-safety-checker node represents the detection threshold for explicit nudity.
What is detected at a sensitivity level of 1.0 in the safety checker node?
At a sensitivity level of 1.0, the ComfyUI-safety-checker node is capable of detecting images containing lingerie or underwear.
How can the safety checker node be incorporated into a ComfyUI setup?
The safety checker node can be incorporated into a ComfyUI setup by connecting an image directly or via VAE Decode. The node processes the input images to identify any NSFW content.
